descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential inflow of individuals who can become experienced.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the stock of core developers as they leave the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by moving experienced contributors into core roles.
A higher promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move into core roles.
The skill up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by transitioning new contributors into this group.
Better explicit documentation accelerates skill development by providing accessible learning resources.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill development through personalized guidance and tacit knowledge sharing.
Effective mentorship increases the promotion rate by preparing experienced contributors for core responsibilities.
